top_procedures.description: Established patient office or other outpatient, visit typically 25 minutes
Ultrasound examination of heart including color-depicted blood flow rate, direction, and valve function
Subsequent hospital inpatient care, typically 25 minutes per day
Initial hospital inpatient care, typically 50 minutes per day
Subsequent hospital inpatient care, typically 35 minutes per day
Heart rhythm tracing, analysis, and interpretation of 48-hour EKG
Remote evaluations of implantable heart monitoring system with physician analysis, review, and report up to 30 days
Remote evaluations of implantable heart recorder system including transmissions, technician review, support, and distribution of results up to 30 days
Remote evaluations of single, dual, or multiple lead cardioverter-defibrillator with physician analysis, review, and report up to 90 days
Evaluation, testing, and programming adjustment of permanent dual lead pacemaker system with physician analysis, review, and report

Interrogation device evaluation(s), (remote) up to 30 days; implantable cardiovascular physiologic monitor system, implantable loop recorder system, or subcutaneous cardiac rhythm monitor system, remote data acquisition(s), receipt of transmissions and tec
Established patient office or other outpatient, visit typically 40 minutes
New patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 45 minutes
Remote evaluations of single, dual, or multiple lead pacemaker or cardioverter-defibrillator transmissions, technician review, support, and distribution of results up to 90 days
Subsequent hospital inpatient care, typically 15 minutes per day
Routine electrocardiogram (EKG) using at least 12 leads with interpretation and report
Evaluation, testing, and programming adjustment of permanent multiple lead cardioverter-defibrillator including physician analysis, review, and report
Evaluation, testing, and programming adjustment of permanent single lead cardioverter-defibrillator including physician analysis, review, and report
Evaluation of parameters of single, dual, or multiple lead cardioverter-defibrillator including connection, recording, disconnection, and analysis
Physician telephone patient service, 21-30 minutes of medical discussion
